DataElement.preferredName: Evoked Response And/Or Conditioning Play Audiometric Test Performed Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not an evoked response and/or conditioning play audiometric test was performed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Evoked Response And/Or Conditioning Play Audiometric Test Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An auditory test utilizing the electrical activity of neural impulses to localize the exact site of a pathologic process that causes the hearing loss._Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options_An auditory test performed in children with hearing impairment.  The child is asked to wait and listen for a specific stimulus.  Subsequently, the child responds by performing a motor activity in response to the specific stimulus._Testing conducted utilizing a manual or microprocessor audiometer to test for hearing loss._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Evoked Response Audiometry And/Or Conditioning Play Audiometry Audiometric Test
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An auditory test utilizing the electrical activity of neural impulses to localize the exact site of a pathologic process that causes the hearing loss.:Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options:An auditory test performed in children with hearing impairment.  The child is asked to wait and listen for a specific stimulus.  Subsequently, the child responds by performing a motor activity in response to the specific stimulus.:Audiometric testing (hearing test) is conducted utilizing a manual or microprocessor audiometer. The test is usually carried out in a sound room or sound test chamber. Used to test for hearing loss.

Concepts.definition: An auditory test utilizing the electrical activity of neural impulses to localize the exact site of a pathologic process that causes the hearing loss.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.

An auditory test performed in children with hearing impairment.  The child is asked to wait and listen for a specific stimulus.  Subsequently, the child responds by performing a motor activity in response to the specific stimulus.
Testing conducted utilizing a manual or microprocessor audiometer to test for hearing loss.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
